title: Unsoundness with `diesel::sqlite::SerializedDatabase::new()`

labels.name: Release Blocker
labels.description: This issue needs to be solved before we can release a new version, it can't be punted to the next

body:
`diesel::sqlite::SerializedDatabase` looks to be memory-unsafe.

## Setup

### Versions

- **Rust:** 1.79.0
- **Diesel:** 2.2.1
- **Database:** sqlite
- **Operating System** macOS Sonoma 14.5

### Feature Flags

- **diesel:** sqlite

## Problem Description

[`diesel::sqlite::SerializedDatabase::new()`](https://docs.diesel.rs/2.2.x/src/diesel/sqlite/connection/serialized_database.rs.html#16) is a safe function that takes a pointer.  [`SerializedDatabase::drop()`](https://docs.diesel.rs/2.2.x/src/diesel/sqlite/connection/serialized_database.rs.html#39) always passes that pointer to [`sqlite3_free()`](https://www.sqlite.org/c3ref/free.html).  That means that the following call will cause heap corruption:
```rust
diesel::sqlite::SerializedDatabase::new(&mut 0, 1);
```

### What are you trying to accomplish?

Safely serialize and deserialize a SQLite database.

### What is the actual output?

### Are you seeing any additional errors?

### Steps to reproduce

`cargo run` segfaults when I put the above example into `main()`:
```sh
$ cat Cargo.toml
[package]
name = "diesel-unsoundness"
[dependencies]
diesel = { version = "2.2.1", default-features = false, features = ["sqlite"] }
$ cat src/main.rs
fn main() {
    diesel::sqlite::SerializedDatabase::new(&mut 0, 1);
}
$ cargo run
    Finished `dev` profile [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.03s
     Running `target/debug/diesel-unsoundness`
zsh: segmentation fault  cargo run
```
